content: This guide will walk you through the basic functions available in the Chain Core Dashboard. This dashboard is built into the Chain Core binary, and is available at all times when your server is running.
If this is your first time launching Chain Core, or you're just looking for a refresher, click "Start" and let's begin.

title: Tutorial - MockHSM keys - Step 1 of 7
content: Cryptographic private keys are the primary authorization mechanism on a blockchain. They control both the issuance and transfer of asset units. An asset or account will define a one or more keys required for issuance or transfers.
Let's begin by creating a new key in our simulated HSM, which we'll use to issue assets.

steps.title: Type a name for key alias (ex. 'gold', 'silver', 'bronze')

description.line: A key alias is a label used to distinguish between keys. We will use this key in the next step.

title: Tutorial - MockHSM keys - Step 1 of 7

content.line: Great work! You created the STRING key.

content: Next up, you will learn about assets and how to create one.

title: Tutorial - Assets - Step 2 of 7
content: An asset is a type of value that can be issued on a blockchain. All units of an asset are fungible and can be transacted directly between parties without the involvement of the issuer.

description.line: An asset alias is a label used to distinguish between assets.

steps.title: Select STRING key to use existing MockHSM key

description.line: This key will be used for the issuance and transfer of asset units.

title: Tutorial - Assets - Step 2 of 7

content.line: Great! You created the STRING asset.

content: Next up, you will learn about accounts and how to create one.

title: Tutorial - Accounts - Step 3 of 7
content: An account is an object in Chain Core that tracks ownership of assets on a blockchain by creating and tracking control programs.
When you create an account, you provide one or more “root” keys and a quorum.

description.line: An account alias is a label used to distinguish between accounts.

steps.title: Type name for key to generate new MockHSM key (ex. 'alice key', 'bob key')

description.line: This key will be used for the issuance and transfer of asset units in this account.

content.line: Great! You created an account for STRING.
Next, you will create a second account to interact with the newly created STRING account.
